page.title: 10INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: Mrs. Skinner's father was the owner of the old windmill in Ellington which was built in the eighteenth century. The mill stood in a field called Mill Peace.Pigeons and vermin lived inside it so the owners sold it to an American man called Mr. Rowland,who moved it to Maddingly.The new owners didn't look after it so it's now in ruins.Mr. Skinner moved to Ellington in 1918 and has owned the pig farm up the present day.When Mr.Skinner first owned the farm he had about two hundred pigs but now he has over three thousand five hundred. The earth in this area is very good for planting crops.Mr.Skinner grows wheat,barley and rape. Mr.Skinner takes part in all the village activities,and has never wished to move away from this area.
